conclusion: Analyze the information provided by the velocity-time (v-t) graph.
Car A starts at 25 m/s and Car B starts at 15 m/s.
Both cars are decelerating linearly, meaning their decelerations are constant.
The cars' velocities become equal at 5 m/s, which occurs at 20 seconds.
Calculate the displacement of each car by the time their velocities equalize (t = 20 seconds).
Find acceleration for Car A: a_A = -1 m/s².
Calculate displacement for Car A: s_A = 300 meters.
Find acceleration for Car B: a_B = -0.5 m/s².
Calculate displacement for Car B: s_B = 200 meters.
Analyze collision possibility: Car A travels 300 meters and Car B travels 200 meters by 20 seconds.
Collision occurs before 20 seconds since Car A closes the gap before velocities equalize.
The two cars collide before 20 seconds of braking.
